item.title: Riot Recommendation: Dystopian Coming of Age Stories
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Joines Schinsky
item.description:
This installment of the Riot Recommendation is sponsored by Taken by Erin Bowman. There are no men in Claysoot. At midnight on every boy’s eighteenth birthday, the ground shakes, the wind howls, a blinding light descends…and the boy is gone. The villagers call it the Heist. item.title: 5 Terrific Modern Chicago Novels
item.dc:creator: Greg Zimmerman
item.description:
It’s only natural to be drawn to novels set in the city in which you live. Thankfully for me, Chicago has a rich tradition as a literary setting — from Saul Bellow’s The Adventures of Augie March to Richard Wright’s Native Son to Audrey Niffenegger’s The Time Traveler’s Wife to Joshua Ferris’s Then We Came To [...]
